description.narrative:
Funds are allocated to the Samoa Program Support Unit (PSU) on an annual basis. The objective of the PSU is to provide administrative, contractural and financial management support to program activities in Samoa. The Samoa PSU currently comprises of seven O-based officers. The PSU allocation in 2008-09 will cover personnel expenses, training, office operating expenses, information technology, vehicle costs, project travel and other expenses.
The existence of the Unit contributes significantly to the success of AusAID's program in Samoa through project monitoring in-country, and allowing A-based staff to concentrate on more complex matters, in particular policy and program development issues.
5. The expanded PSU model for in-country management of the bilateral program is operating effectively with PSU assuming greater responsibility, due to devolution, for activity management, monitoring performance of programs and interacting with Government of Samoa officials
